business.headline: Adani Group gets clean chit from Sebi over Hindenburg claimsHindenburg Research had alleged that four Adani group companies lent Rs 6.2 billion ($87.4 million) in 2020, without properly disclosing it in financial statements.
Can you own a credit card without a bank account? Find outYou don't always need a savings account to apply for a credit card; new digital options are changing the rules. Have a look.

Are Fed rate cut and tariff relief setting up a market rally?A softer stance from the US Federal Reserve and the possibility of reduced reciprocal tariffs have lifted investor mood. The big question now: are these triggers enough to set off a sustained rally in Indian markets?

Sensex, Nifty extend rally on US-India trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 318.97 points to finish at 83,012.68, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 93.35 points to settle at 25,423.60. Broader markets, however, displayed mixed momentum, with several indices ending weaker as profit-booking set in.

US may scrap 25% penal duty on India, cut reciprocal tariffs to 10–15%: CEAChief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran indicated that the US reciprocal tariff on Indian goods, currently at 25%, may be reduced to 10–15%.

iValue Infosolutions IPO opens: Should you consider subscribing?iValue Infosolutions plans to Rs 560 crore through an offer-for-sale of 1.87 crore shares. The price band is set at Rs 284–299 per share, with a minimum investment of 50 shares.

Why gold loans are no longer just a last resort for borrowersGold loans are shedding their emergency-only image, becoming a mainstream credit choice for urban, semi-urban, and rural India, driven by gold prices, regulation, digital access, and flexible borrowing solutions.

Should investors buy IT stocks right now? Here's what Ventura Securities saysVentura Securities warns of a shift, with US-driven risks mounting, domestic sectors like banking and NBFCs offer a safer path, leaving IT investors to weigh growth against growing uncertainty.

DreamFolks crisis explained: What's going on and what it means for investorsFounded in 2013, DreamFolks acted as a platform connecting banks, credit card companies, and passengers to airport lounges, food services, baggage handling, and other airport amenities.

US Fed cuts rates for 1st time this year. Will it give a boost to Dalal Street?Lower US interest rates tend to make emerging markets like India more attractive to foreign portfolio investors (FPIs), as dollar assets lose some shine and Treasury yields ease.

Urban Company shares register bumper debut on Dalal Street, but what's next?Urban Company's shares, issued at Rs 103, opened at Rs 162.25 and surged as much as 74% during the day. For those who got shares in the IPO, that meant instant profits and a near $3 billion market value for the company.

Ben & Jerry's co-founder quits, accuses Unilever of silencing brand's activismBen & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield has stepped down from the company after 47 years, saying its independence to speak on social issues has been eroded under Unilever's ownership. Unilever, which is spinning off its ice cream business, thanked Greenfield for his service but disagreed with his claims.

Varun Dhawan gets trolled for interrupting Janhvi Kapoor's AI remark: DisrespectfulAt the trailer launch of 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari', Janhvi Kapoor spoke about the misuse of AI-generated images, but Varun Dhawan interrupted her with a joke, sparking backlash online. Urmila Matondkar's birthday wish for Shabana Azmi has nostalgic Masoom throwbackOn Shabana Azmi's birthday, actor Urmila Matondkar shared a heartfelt note and nostalgic photos from her debut film 'Masoom', recalling their decades-long bond. general news.headline: I am very close to India and Modi: Trump after repeated rant over Russia oil tradeUS President Donald Trump, while addressing reporters during his UK visit, said that he is very close to India and Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Telangana techie shot dead by US cops, family seeks help to bring back bodyTelangana techie Mohammed Nizamuddin was shot dead by Santa Clara police after allegedly stabbing his roommate. His family disputes details, seeks repatriation, while US police cite self-defence and recovered knives.

US revokes sanctions waiver for India, other countries at Iran's Chabahar portThe waiver had allowed India and other countries to continue work on the port without facing US penalties. The US has now revoked the sanction exemption, and it will come into effect from September 29.

UP man's number shown at Rahul Gandhi press meet. He gets bombarded with callsAnjani Mishra, who lives in Prayagraj, said he was surprised to see his number mentioned by Rahul Gandhi at the September 18 press briefing. Lionel Messi and Inter Miami enter discussions for contract extension: ReportsLionel Messi is set to extend his Inter Miami stay, with reports indicating a deal until 2027. His stunning impact on MLS has transformed the club and boosted American soccer's global profile.

Swiatek to become No.1? Sabalenka's China Open pullout spices up raceAryna Sabalenka's withdrawal from the China Open opens the door for Iga Swiatek to close the gap in the race for the WTA No.1 ranking. A strong run in Seoul and Beijing could bring Swiatek within striking distance of the top spot.

Highlights: Neeraj Chopra's title defence ends, young Sachin finishes credible 4thWorld Athletics Championships Day 6 Live: Defending champion Neeraj Chopra failed to defend his title in the men's javelin final after failing to go past the 85m mark in his first five attempts. He was eighth after the fourth throw and fouled the fifth one to exit the competition. India's Sachin Yadav, meanwhile, produced a personal best of 86.27m but narrowly missed out on a medal, finishing fourth. Trinidad and Tobago's Keshorn Walcott clinched gold, Grenada's Anderson Peters secured silver, and USA's Curtis Thompson took home the bronze.

Neeraj vs Arshad: Why India vs Pakistan in the javelin final is only a subplotWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Neeraj Chopra and Arshad Nadeem's rivalry will grab subcontinental headlines, but the men's javelin final in Tokyo is stacked with world-class talent. From Germany's Julian Weber to former champions Anderson Peters and Julius Yego, the contest promises far more than just an India-Pakistan subplot.

Akeal Hosein captain, 5 uncapped players in as West Indies reveal Nepal series squadWest Indies have announced their squad for the upcoming historic series against Nepal with five uncapped players included in the mix. Akeal Hosein will be leading the team in the absence of many senior players.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
